decks.notes: This deck focuses on the efficient use of UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up to powerful threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with control elements such as Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker. The deck also includes versatile cards like Dismember and Kozilek's Command to handle a variety of situations. The goal is to establish board control and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and disruption, using the synergy of UrzaTron lands and Eldrazi creatures to dominate the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a powerful combo using cards like Lotus Bloom, Thundertrap Trainer, and Goblin Charbelcher. The deck focuses on denying opponent's spells with counterspells like Disrupting Shoal and Force of Negation, while digging for combo pieces with cards like Whir of Invention and Waterlogged Teachings. The deck aims to outpace and disrupt opponents without relying on traditional land cards, creating a fast and unique playstyle centered around powerful combos and spell denial.

The main strategy of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a combination of hand disruption cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending. The deck also aims to put pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Boggart Trawler and Emperor of Bones. Additionally, it leverages flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to repeatedly trigger powerful enter-the-battlefield abilities on creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Witch Enchanter. Finally, the deck uses Teferi, Time Raveler to control the tempo of the game and protect its own threats.

This deck focuses on aggressive strategies with a heavy emphasis on disruption and hand control. It utilizes powerful cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Emperor of Bones to pressure the opponent. The inclusion of Eldrazi creatures and artifacts like Urza's Saga provide additional reach and flexibility, creating a versatile and resilient Mono Black Aggro deck that can adapt to various matchups and disrupt the opponent's resources effectively.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly get out low-cost artifacts on the battlefield and then pump them up with various equipment and enchantments to deal damage efficiently and aggressively. The deck utilizes cards like Cranial Plating, Galvanic Blast, and Metallic Rebuke to control the board and deal heavy damage to the opponent. By using cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to generate mana and draw power from cards like Thoughtcast and Mishra's Bauble, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and powerful attacks.

This deck focuses on assembling the Allosaurus Rider combo to quickly summon Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and win the game. The key strategy revolves around using Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to search for Allosaurus Rider, while also utilizing Consign to Memory and Disciple of Freyalise to control the board and generate mana. Additionally, the deck includes Planar Genesis to ramp up lands and increase the chances of a successful combo. Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer provide protection against disruption, ensuring the combo can go off smoothly.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive plays, utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory to provide additional support and buffs to the creatures. With a mix of burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and versatile options like Thraben Charm, the deck aims to maintain constant pressure on the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo using cards that manipulate mana and counter spells, ultimately leading to a win condition with Goblin Charbelcher. It utilizes a mix of card draw, counterspells, and mana acceleration to disrupt the opponent and protect its key pieces. The deck aims to quickly set up its combo while controlling the game through counterspells and removal, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a powerful finish.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, while also utilizing a sacrifice theme with Goblin Bombardment and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. The deck includes powerful threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, supported by cards like Guide of Souls and Arena of Glory to maintain pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes efficient removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to control the board and secure victory through fast, aggressive plays.

The deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures and ramp spells to quickly cast powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also includes control elements like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to deal with opposing threats. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells while ramping into its powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent with big threats. The Talisman of Impulse and Utopia Sprawl help accelerate mana production, allowing the deck to cast its big spells ahead of schedule.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to swarm the board with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, backed up by powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Voice of Victory, while also potentially locking opponents out of the game with Blood Moon. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with its efficient creatures and removal spells, maintaining a fast and aggressive pace throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to quickly generate massive amounts of mana in order to cast high impact Eldrazi creatures such as Devourer of Destiny and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn, the Great Creator to control the board and provide additional win conditions. This control-focused strategy is further supported by removal spells like Dismember and board wipes like All Is Dust to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly playing artifacts and reducing their cost with cards like Mox Opal and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary while disrupting their strategy with cards like Portable Hole and Metallic Rebuke. The deck utilizes cards like Urza's Saga to create powerful artifact tokens and generate card advantage with Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast. By combining efficient creatures, disruptive spells, and powerful artifacts, the deck seeks to apply pressure and win the game quickly.

The primary focus of this deck is to apply aggressive pressure on the opponent while utilizing disruptive elements to control the game. This is achieved through a combination of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Overlord of the Balemurk, supported by removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize. Additionally, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Flickerwisp and Witch Enchanter. The mana base is carefully crafted to support a diverse range of spells and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The key concept of the UR Aggro deck is to quickly deploy low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, while using spells like Mutagenic Growth, Lightning Bolt, and Lava Dart to control the board and deal damage to the opponent. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent through aggressive plays and card advantage from cards like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble. By combining efficient creatures with burn spells and card selection, the UR Aggro deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can establish a strong board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary lands and combo pieces to ramp up and play Primeval Titan to search for game-ending lands such as Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, and bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber to generate extra mana and trigger Valakut multiple times in a turn. The deck also utilizes Amulet of Vigor to untap lands that enter the battlefield tapped, allowing for explosive plays and utilizing lands like Lotus Field to generate large amounts of mana. This combo-oriented strategy aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful land synergies and finish them off with massive Valakut triggers.
